intro: Alibertia sessilis var. reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined alibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
